definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

sentences.english: There were times when the Germans became suspicious, and she was even interviewed by the Gestapo.
sentences.chinese: 德國人有時起疑，蓋世太保甚至找她問話。

sentences.english: Instead, Rabe was arrested by the Gestapo.
sentences.chinese: 不料蓋世太保反而把拉伯拘捕。

sentences.english: You mean you want me to beat up Jews with my truncheon and catch the Gestapo spirit.
sentences.chinese: 你的意思是想讓我和蓋世太保一樣用警棍毆打猶太人。

sentences.english: The Gestapo called her the “White Mouse”.
Regina was arrested, on November 6th, by the Gestapo.
sentences.chinese: 11月6日，蓋世太保將雷吉娜逮捕。

sentences.english: As a German-enlisted man, he killed 13 Gestapo officers.
sentences.chinese: 他作爲一個德國軍人，卻殺了13個蓋世太保。

sentences.english: Gestapo put her arrest, locked up in a "children's health camp".
sentences.chinese: 蓋世太保把她抓起來，關進了“兒童健康營”。

sentences.english: Shortly after their marriage, Laszlo was apprehended by Gestapo[4].
sentences.chinese: 但婚後不久，拉茲洛就被蓋世太保抓走了。
